text: Robert Alexander Mundell, CC (October 24, 1932 - April 4, 2021) was a Canadian economist. He was a professor of economics at Columbia University and the Chinese University of Hong Kong. Mundell was also known for the Mundell–Fleming model and Mundell–Tobin effect. He received the Nobel Memorial Prize in Economic Sciences in 1999 for his pioneering work in monetary dynamics and optimum currency areas. Mundell is known as the "father" of the Euro, as he laid the groundwork for its introduction through this work and helped to start the movement known as supply-side economics which inspired Reaganomics. Mundell died on April 4, 2021 in Siena, Tuscany from problems caused by bile duct cancer, aged 88. ==References== ==Other websites== * Robert Mundell's homepage * Single Global Currency Association – Bretton Woods 2024 * his analysis of monetary and fiscal policy under different exchange rate regimes and his analysis of optimum currency areas. * Economista canadiense.
